channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for ND
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for ND

item.title: Report E-2024080697
item.description:
Report E-2024080697

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-15
  • City: WEST FARGO
  • State: ND
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDEX FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Associate did not block and/or brace freight properly for transport. Freight was crushed causing release of product.

item.title: Report X-2024081656
item.description:
Report X-2024081656

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-23
  • City: FARGO
  • State: ND
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Wet package was brought to QA. No inner packaging materials found. 2 plastic bottles capable of containing 2.5 liquid gallons of Ethanolamine were in the fiberboard box. Exterior applicable markings for being HAZMAT with UN2735, amines, liquid, corrosive, n.o.s., (Ethanolamine), 8, PG II, 46lbs, 1 box, corrosive, and included directional arrows. 1 of 2 plastic bottles Ethanolamine leaked due to loose cap. Only exterior packaging was damaged. No other clean up was necessary, and remaining product placed into appropriate salvage drum. Package is awaiting further disposition.
